intro: Holocarpha heermannii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by distinctive, spiny seed pods. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture that helps reduce water loss. Holocarpha heermannii plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds, due to its nectar-rich flowers and protective seed structures.
